results.title: The Cumulative Incidence and Risk Factors of Recurrent Venous Thromboembolism in the Elderly
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may have a protective effect against recurrent @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@VTE@@@ in the elderly population, and a larger study is needed to validate our findings.

citations.NLM: Aleidan FAS. The Cumulative Incidence and Risk Factors of Recurrent Venous Thromboembolism in the Elderly Vasc Health Risk Manag. 2020;16():437-443. PMID: 33116554

results.title: [Effect of metformin on the incidence of venous thromboembolism in medical inpatients during hospitalization].
results.text_hl: [Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on the incidence of @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@venous thromboembolism@@@ in medical inpatients during hospitalization].

results.title: Association of Metformin Use With Risk of Venous Thromboembolism in Adults With Type 2 Diabetes: A General-Population-Based Cohort Study.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is hypothesized to protect against the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@venous thromboembolism@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@VTE@@@); however, there is a paucity of data supporting this hypothesis.

citations.NLM: Sha T, Zhang Y, Li C, Lei G, Wu J, Li X, Yang Z, Zeng C, Wei J. Association of Metformin Use With Risk of Venous Thromboembolism in Adults With Type 2 Diabetes: A General-Population-Based Cohort Study. Am J Epidemiol. 2022 Mar 24;191(5):856-866. PMID: 34999759

results.title: AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF CLINICAL ENDOCRINOLOGISTS, AMERICAN COLLEGE OF ENDOCRINOLOGY, AND ANDROGEN EXCESS AND PCOS SOCIETY DISEASE STATE CLINICAL REVIEW: GUIDE TO THE BEST PRACTICES IN THE EVALUATION AND TREATMENT OF POLYCYSTIC OVARY SYNDROME - PART 2.
results.text_hl: Subjects with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ have a 1.5-times higher baseline risk of @<m>DISEASE_Venous_Thromboembolism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054556 @@@venous thromboembolic disease@@@ and a 3.7-fold greater effect with OCP use compared with non-@DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ subjects.

citations.NLM: Goodman NF, Cobin RH, Futterweit W, Glueck JS, Legro RS, Carmina E, American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE), American College of Endocrinology (ACE), Androgen Excess and PCOS Society. Endocr Pract. 2015 Dec;21(12):1415-26. PMID: 26642102
